title: Obsidian vs Craft for Power users
meta_description: Obsidian vs Craft for power users who want local file control, extensibility, and long-term second brain flexibility.
constraint_lens: You want full control over your files and the freedom to extend your system without platform limits.

verdict.summary: Obsidian wins for power users building an extensible second brain. It stores notes as local Markdown files and supports a large community plugin ecosystem. Craft runs as a hosted workspace with block-based documents and export limitations tied to its model. If block-level structure and export flexibility are constrained by a hosted model, Craft fails first.
verdict.decision_rule: If block-level structure and export flexibility are constrained by a hosted model, Craft fails first.

sections.heading: Best fit for long-term extensibility
sections.content: You want full control over local files and extensibility as your knowledge base grows. Obsidian stores everything in a vault folder you manage directly. Craft organizes notes inside a hosted workspace where structure and exports follow its block model.

bullets.point: Local Markdown files stored in a vault
bullets.why_it_matters: You can open, edit, or back up notes outside the app without converting formats.
You can install plugins for tasks, spaced repetition, dashboards, and custom queries, expanding system behavior.

bullets.point: Backlinks and graph view across the vault
bullets.why_it_matters: You can build a networked knowledge map that scales beyond folder hierarchies.
You can create visually structured pages with styled blocks and sections.
You can share documents via link without configuring sync tools.
Your notes update automatically through the hosted account system.

sections.heading: Where each tool can break down

items.fails_when: You want a polished collaborative editor without managing plugins or local files.
items.what_to_do_instead: Use Craft if you prioritize presentation and built-in sharing.

items.fails_when: You need raw file access, deep automation, or export flexibility beyond the block format.
items.what_to_do_instead: Switch to Obsidian for local control and extensibility.

sections.heading: When this verdict might flip
sections.content: If collaboration and presentation matter more than local ownership and plugin extensibility, Craft may feel more practical despite its hosted limits.

sections.heading: Quick rules
rules: If you want full local file control, choose Obsidian.
If hosted block structure feels limiting, avoid Craft.
If collaboration and polish matter more than extensibility, consider Craft.

faqs.q: Which has the higher extensibility ceiling?
faqs.a: Obsidian generally has the higher ceiling due to plugins and direct file access.
Craft is better for built-in sharing and collaborative editing.
